epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Destroy all matching items. Once destroyed the items will be gone forever - this action cannot be undone!
Are you absolutely sure you want to destroy all these items (this action cannot be undone)?
The search expression could not be found - you will need to re-do your search and start again.
You attempted to apply some changes but didn't specify any actions to take?
Applying batch alterations to items (only first shown):
Author in quotations or text extracts

epp:phrase.p: For work being deposited by its own author: In self-archiving this collection of files and associated bibliographic metadata, I grant the right to store them and to make them permanently available publicly for free on-line. I declare that this material is my own intellectual property and I understand that does not assume any responsibility if there is any breach of copyright in distributing these files or metadata. (All authors are urged to prominently assert their copyright on the title page of their work.)

For work being deposited by someone other than its author: I hereby declare that the collection of files and associated bibliographic metadata that I am archiving at ) is in the public domain. If this is not the case, I accept full responsibility for any breach of copyright that distributing these files or metadata may entail.
Clicking on the deposit button indicates your agreement to these terms.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase:
The title of the item. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. There is no way to make italic text, please enter it normally. If you have a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: A brief history of time
Example: Life: an unauthorised biography
Example: Mathematics for engineers and scientists. 5th edition
Example: Ecosystems of the world. Vol. 26. Estuaries of the world

The title of the book, usually found on the title page. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. There is no way to make italic text, please enter it normally. If it has a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: A brief history of time
Example: Life: an unauthorised biography
Example: Mathematics for engineers and scientists. 5th edition
Example: Ecosystems of the world. Vol. 26. Estuaries of the world
A summary of the items content. If the item has a formal abstract then that is what should be entered here. No complicated text formatting is possible.
Natural language terms to describe the content of the item
Companies that are considered authors of this item.

Enter in the format given on the first page or title page. If there are more than four authors, click on the [More input rows] button.
Example: [Smith] [J.P.] [j.smith@soton.ac.uk]
Example: [Chance-Collins] [Chris] [chris@bar.com]
Example: [Fu] [Yan-Li] []
Example: [von Höpfner] [Ludwig G.] []

The total number of pages of the item.
Example: 123

Numerals only. The sequence of pages of the item. Do not enter pp.
Example: 21 to 34

The name of the series to which the document belongs. Enter without punctuation.
Example: Elsevier Oceanography Series

The title of a journal, publication or magazine.
Example: Marine Biology

A person, firm or corporate body responsible for placing an item on the market. Do not use abbreviations, enter in full.
Example: Oxford University Press

Locality of the publisher. Use city or town then country. If city is not known then just use country.
Example: Southampton, UK
Example: Brazil

City or town then country where event was held. If city is not known then just use country.
Example: Rome, Italy
Example: Greece

Start and end dates for the event
Example: 13-15 Dec 2003
Example: 31 Oct - 02 Nov 1999

The title of the conference or workshop.
Example: 11th Conference of Pan-Hellenic Librarians
Example: SIGIR 2001

Unique code identifying a book.
Example: 1 871438 57 8
Example: 067157826X

Unique code identifying a serial.
Example: 1055-0143
Example: 0891-060X
The type of the item presented at a conference or workshop.
Title usually found on the title page (first page of book).

The canonical URL for this item. Some journals require you to provide a link to their version.
Example: http://www.stuffjournal.com/2003/3/
URLs that are related to this item.

Please enter the names of the editors.
This field is required if no creators are listed.
The date this EPrint was completed, submitted to a publisher, published or submitted for a Ph.D.
The event to which the date applies.
Enter the volume number of the journal or series in which your item appeared.
Enter the issue number of the journal or series in which your item appeared.
The unique identification number of this item, or a DOI.
The patent application number of this item.
The number, if any, of a technical report or similar item.
Please select the specific type of this monograph.
Please state here whether your deposit has been published, is currently in the process of being published (in press), or has not been previously published.
Please indicate whether this version of the work been refereed below.

epp:phrase.label: Yes, this version has been refereed.
No, this version has not been refereed.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: You are strongly encouraged to paste in the reference list of your item into the box below. It may be used to link your item to those it cites and to those that cite it.
Please select at least one main subject category, and optionally up to two other subject categories you think are appropriate for your submission, from the list below.

If you think you can specify some useful information about your deposit that can't be entered anywhere else, please enter it here. This information will appear on the public summary page for this item.
Any comments to the editor. This information will not be displayed to the public.

Please enter the department from which the item originated.
Example: School of Electronics and Computer Science

Please enter the institution from which the item originated.
Example: University of Southampton

The name of the applicant to whom the patent was granted. May be a person or an organisation.
Example: Purdue Research Institute
Example: John K. Ducklingson
The contact email address for this item. If the full-text is not available to the public, then requests to view the full-text will be sent to this email. The email address will not be made public.
The sponsoring bodies who contributed funding for the creation of this item.
The names or codes of the projects that created this item.
The divisions with which this item should be associated.

The media of output.
Example: CD-ROM
Example: DVD

The type of the composition
Example: Concerto
Example: Opera
A person, firm or corporate body which holds the copyright for the item.
The pedagogic type that defines the resource.
The approximate learning time required to complete.
Outline of the main purpose of the tasks involved.

The skill areas covered.
Example: Language Learning

The learning level. This should link to a national/international framework to allow easy comparison of resources.
Example: Breakthrough 1-3
Example: GCSE
A book or a conference volume.
A chapter or section in a book.
An article in a journal, magazine, newspaper. Not necessarily peer-reviewed. May be an electronic-only medium, such as an online journal or news website.

A paper, poster, speech, lecture or presentation given at a conference, workshop or other event. If the conference item has been published in a journal or book then please use "Book Section" or "Article" instead.
A monograph. This may be a technical report, project report, documentation, manual, working paper or discussion paper.
A published patent. Do not include as yet unpublished patent applications.
Something within the scope of the repository, but not covered by the other categories.
An artist's artefact or work product.
An artist's exhibition or site specific performance-based deposit.
A digital photograph or visual image.
A bounded collection of quantitative data (e.g. spreadsheet or XML data file).
Experimental data with intermediate analyses and summary results.
Lecture notes, exercises, exam papers or course syllabuses.
Here you can download the entire page to edit offline using editors such as frontpage and re-upload it back into EPrints. Image manipulation is not supported.

epp:phrase.p: Unfortunately your item could not be accepted into as-is.
The item has been returned to your workspace. You may wish to edit your item, fix the problem, and redeposit.
Unfortunately your item could not be accepted into as-is.
The item has been deleted.
'' has been deleted from your User Area.
Dear User,
You have requested your email to be changed to
To activate this new address please click here.
Dear User,
Thank you for your interest in .
You now need to activate your password. This will expire in .
Your username is: .
After you have successfully confirmed your password, you can deposit items here.

Once you have confirmed your identity you may also subscribe to the email alerts service, to be automatically informed of new deposits in the repository in your chosen subject areas in a daily, weekly or monthly digest.
Have your username and password ready when visiting any of the above pages.
This message was generated automatically by software. If you have any questions, then please feel free to email a real person at:
Contact us at

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Metadata field properties have sensible defaults that can be overriden by specifying a value on this page. If you wish to use the default leave the value as UNSPECIFIED.
The metadata field name you specified already exists in this dataset.

epp:phrase.p: Note: For this to work the web server must have write access to the var, phrases and workflow directories for this repository.

When you commit this new metadata field its configuration will be written to the metadata fields configuration file and the appropriate columns added to the database. If you specified a name and help phrase for this field they will be added to the fields.xml phrases file for each language you specified (see also the phrases documentation).
If this field is being added to the Eprints dataset it will also be added to the Eprints submission workflow (see also the workflow documentation).
To make use of your new field (e.g. by adding it to the abstract page) look at HOW TO: Add a New Field.
If you don't want to add a new field now click Save for Later.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Failed to add this field's phrase, you should check that your phrases directory is writable.
Failed to add this field to the workflow, you should check that your workflow directory is writable.

This tool allows you to add metadata fields to your repository. Only fields added using this tool can be removed by this tool. To start configuring fields choose a dataset to add/remove fields from the following list.
The name of a field must contain only the letters a-z and underscore (requested name was "")
The field "" you are attempting to modify doesn't appear to be configured for the dataset "" (perhaps it's a system field?).

You are about to edit the configuration and database settings for the field in the dataset. You may permanently lose data any stored in ! If you are sure this is what you want to do click the confirm button.

You are about to remove the configuration and database settings for the field in the dataset. This means you will permanently lose any data stored in ! If you are sure this is what you want to do click the confirm button.
Added the configuration and database settings for the field in the dataset.
Removed the configuration and database settings for the field in the dataset.
Renamed old field in the configuration and database settings to in the dataset.
Failed to remove the field. You should ensure the web server has write access to the fields configuration file for this repository.
An integer that will automatically increase by 1 for every new object.
A date/time that will automatically be initialised to the current date/time.
Select from a list of configured languages in the repository.
A container for other fields. The interface for adding compound fields is complex and may allow you to create an inconsistent configuration, use with care!
Select from a list of fields in a data set.
Select a file from the user's file system.
A reference to another object in the repository.
A large text field (more than 255 characters).

A multi-lingual field behaves the same as a Compound field but always has a "lang" sub-field that is a set of the currently configured languages. Use this type of field to allow users to enter metadata in more than one language.
The name of a person, consisting of honourific, given, family and lineage parts.
A Set that takes its values from a namedset file.
A Set of values to choose from (if you are likely to ever change the set of values use namedset instead).
Choose a value from the subjects hierarchy.
The human-readable name of this field - will be shown above the field input.
The optional help text to show for this field.
Select the fields you would like to use as part of this compound field.
The name of a field should be made up of lowercase English letters.

Choose from the available metadata field types to determine the type of information you want to capture. The field type will determine the form elements used, data constraints and rendering in Web pages.
Compound and Multilang are special fields that allow you to combine multiple sub-fields in a logical fashion (for instance "name" and "email"). The way fields behave can be refined by using properties.
For more information see MetaFields.
Specify the type of data the field will contain. The available types are defined by MetaField classes.
Whether the user is required to enter data for this field (may be overridden in the workflow).
Whether this field should allow more than one value.
Whether this field can be undefined (NULL) in the database.
Whether this field should be exported in EPrints XML. You may not want to export things like passwords or other sensitive data.
By default any changes to an object will trigger a new revision of that object. By setting a field as volatile changes made just to volatile fields will not cause new revisions to occur.
Whether this field should have a database index added to it.
The name of a custom input render function.
The name of a custom render function.
Set to true if the order of the values is important (applicable to multiple fields).
Maximum number of characters to allow the user to enter. Use input_cols to control the size of the form input control.
When rendering values you can add a link on the value to the browse view pages. Specify the name of the view to link the value to - this will depend on the views you have defined.
Top element of the subject hierarchy to show.
The repository dataset to link the object identifier to (e.g. "eprint").
The name of the file to read the option values from (in /cfg/namedsets).
A comma-separated list of values to choose from (e.g. london,paris,new_york)). You will need to create phrases for every defined option.
The order to render the name value in (family, given or given family).
Hide the honourific name part in the submission workflow.
Hide the lineage name part in the submission workflow.
Whether to show the family first in the submission workflow.
Input style of the set selector.
Input rows to show (lines of text, or options visible).
Input columns to show (columns of text). To restrict the maximum number of characters entered for text fields use the maxlength property.
Starting number of input rows to show (if field is multiple). As users add values more rows will be shown.
The name of the counter used to get the next incremented value, must be made up of lowercase English characters or underscore.
Unspecified or unknown dataset id "" given
Check that you have entered the same secret twice.
Full text not available from this repository.

You haven't specified a document type!
You need to select a file to be shown first.

epp:phrase.p: The amount of disk space available for new EPrints has dropped below the repository threshold. New disk space will be needed soon.
If you get sick of this message, lower the "diskspace_warn_threshold" in the config file. If you do this then don't forget to put it back after you add more disk space.
The usual way to add disk space is to symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory.
There are no available partitions with enough disk space to create new items. This needs sorting out urgently.
NO NEW ITEMS WILL BE ADDED UNTIL YOU FIX THIS.
To add more capacity, symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: A year search must be specified as a single year, e.g. `2000', or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or `-2000'
A numerical search must be specified as a single integer number, e.g. `23', or a range of numbers, e.g. `9-21', `17-' or `-93'
A date search must be specified as a single date or a range.
Search field contains no indexable words: "". The system ignores very small or common words.
Enter some text to search for.
Select one or more values from the list. Default is (Any).
Enter a term or terms to search for.

Enter a name or names to search for. Either the family name, or the family name followed by a comma and the first name or initial. Names with spaces may be indicated by surrounding them with double quotes, eg. "van Damme, J".
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Enter one or more usernames (space separated) and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter an exact term to search for.
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter some text to search for.
Enter a single year (e.g. 1999), or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or -2000'.
Enter a single number (e.g. 93), or a range of numbers, e.g. `17-23', `17-' or -23'.
Enter a single number (e.g. 3.14159), or a range of numbers, e.g. `4.8-15', `16-' or -23.42'.
Select a single record ID number (e.g. 93), or a range of numbers, e.g. `17-23', `17-' or -23'.

epp:phrase.p: Please enter the URL of the item you wish to upload to the repository in the box below.

Occasionally, uploading this way may not produce a totally accurate copy. This is because some assumptions about the structure of the HTML must be made, to stop the software from trying to upload the whole World-Wide Web!

Thank you.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The specified ID code is not a valid ID code.
Please enter the ID code of the item you wish to view below. You can enter a standard ID code, an Open Archives full ID code, or just the digits on the right hand side of an ID code.

epp:phrase.p: There was a problem with the data you entered in :
Registration is not enabled on this system.
In order to access some areas of the repository, you'll need a user registration. No charge is made for registering with us or using any of our services.
This page lets you register with . This will allow you to save searches, receive alerts and deposit items.
A confirmation email will be sent to you. You need to activate your account using the link in the email.
If you have already registered but have forgotten your username or password, click here to set a new password.
As a registered user you will be able to set up saved searches, which are sent when new items are placed in the repository.
Please complete the details on this page to register with .
A confirmation email will be sent to you. You need to activate your account using the link in the email.
If you have already registered but have forgotten your username or password, click here to set a new password.

Rather than register, you should just reset your password.

You have registered with username .

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This will set which language is used for automated emails
A username must begin with a letter and only contain letters and numerals.
A combination of uppercase and lowercase letters and numerals.

epp:phrase.p: To register, use the Registration Form.
If you have registered but have forgotten the password you may set a new password using the Reset Password Form.
This feature is not available on this system.
If you are an existing user but have forgotten your password then you may use this form to set a new one.
You did not specify an email address.
There is no account with email address "".
The user with the email address may not change their password via this mechanism. If this is a problem please contact the site administrator.
You did not actually specify a password.
An email has been sent to containing the code required to confirm this password.
This code is only valid for .
Nothing new in the last 7 days.
User not found. It is possible that indicates a database problem, but please check the parameters in the URL carefully.
The confirmation pin is incorrect. Please try and reset your password to generate an email with a new confirmation pin number.
The confirmation pin number has timed out. Please repeat the reset password or registration request, and confirm it as soon as you get the email.
There are currently no changes for this user which await confirmation. This probably means you have already confirmed the change. Try and login.
Your email address has been changed to
Your password has been changed to the new one you requested.
Your username on this system is:
The OpenURL resolver only supports CGI arguments.
The OpenURL resolver couldn't find the record you searched for.

epp:phrase.div: Please select a value to browse from the list below.
Number of items at this level: .
Items may be browsed by the following:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The number of items () for this view has exceeded system limits (). The system administrator either needs to increase "max_items" or apply additional filters to this view.

epp:phrase.p: No items in this section.

p.a: Go to the User Area Homepage

epp:phrase.p: Bad parameters. Do not try and access this script directly.
This feature has been disabled for this repository.
The system is currently unable to send email. Please try again later. If this problem persists, please contact the administrator with details.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Please select the most appropriate type for your deposit.
If this item is a revised version of another document in the repository, please enter its ID code in this box.
If your item is a commentary on another item (or author's response to a commentary) in the repository, please enter its ID in this box.
The Latitude of this item. Southern latitudes should be expressed as a negative.
The Longitude of this item. Western longitudes should be expressed as a negative.
This field describes relationships this item has to other entities. Ideally, use URIs for the target identifier.
by date of most recent issue
Username must be a combination of letters and numbers. This may be your email address.
Leaving this field blank will not affect the password.
Set a password. This will not be activated until you enter a security code which will be mailed to you.
The subjects within which this user may "edit" eprints. That is they may review and approve/bounce them etc.
The email address for this user
This must be a valid email address.
Your preferred language. Where possible information will be mailed in this language.
This field allows an administrator to assign roles to a user. It may also be used to assign (and remove) individual privileges by prefixing the priv string with plus (+) or minus (-).
This must be a valid OpenID endpoint e.g. https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id
The user will only be able to approve and modify items which match the following rules. If there are no restriction conditions the user will be able to edit any item.
How often do you want to be sent a list of all the items in review matching your editorial scope.
If there are no items under review, within your scope, should the repository still send you an empty email?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, mail me when there is nothing under review.
No. Only mail me when there is something under review and within my scope.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The Latitude associated with this user. Southern latitudes should be expressed as a negative.
The Longitude associated with this user. Western longitudes should be expressed as a negative.
Please indicate the primary language of this format.
Please select the storage format of this document.
You may offer an additional brief description of the format.
The content of this document, as opposed to the format.

Please indicate the required "security level" of this document. Who is allowed to download it? If you set this to anything other than "anyone" then consider adding a contact email for this eprint (on the next page), this will allow users to use a web form to request a copy of the document, and you can decide on a case-by-case basis.
Specify an explicit license for this document (does not affect the access rights you grant at the end of this deposit process). This repository allows Creative Commons licenses.

The date that a publisher- or sponsor-imposed embargo expires. On and after this date, this document will be made publicly accessible.
Example: 2014 - all documents made publicly accessible on 1st January 2014
Example: 2014 June - all documents made publicly accessible on 1st June 2014
This field describes relationships this document has to other entities. Ideally, use URIs for the target identifier.
The file which is linked to.
This is the "screen" name of the subject, the one that the users will see.
Subjects which this subject is part of (including itself).
Can users add items to this subject?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, users can add items to this subject.
No. (In which case it should probably have some children.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This is the internal key for this subject. It is used in the database and to generate the "views" filenames. It should contain only a-z, 0-9 and dash "/"and underscore "_".
This screen () does not know how to process this action: .
The requested screen does not exist, or has a fatal error: .
You may not view this screen: .
You may not perform that action.
This item is temporarily locked. Please go back and try again in a few minutes.
Really remove this column from the display?

epp:phrase.p: This page shows items which you have not yet deposited, or which are still under review.
To start depositing an item use the "New Item" button, and follow the instructions.
If you stop before completing the deposit, or a deposit is returned for corrections, it will appear in the list as in the "User Workarea".
Click on an icon to the right of an item to:

tr.td: View Item in Detail, including additional actions

epp:phrase.p: To reorder the list of items, click on the title of the column to sort by. Clicking a second time will reverse the order.
You may modify the columns displayed. Add a new column using the menu at the bottom of the page.
This page shows items awaiting review.
Click on an icon to the right of an item to:

tr.td: View Item in Detail, including additional actions
Return Item to Depositor (and notify depositing user)
Destroy Item (with notification to depositing user)

epp:phrase.p: To reorder the list of items, click on the title of the column to sort by. Clicking a second time will reverse the order.
You may modify the columns displayed. Add a new column using the menu at the bottom of the page.

epp:phrase.p: Before depositing this item you must resolve the problems identified.
As an editor of this item you can move it into review without first resolving the problems identified otherwise click to fix these problems later.
As an editor of this item you can move it into the archive without first resolving the problems identified otherwise click to fix these problems later.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Although you are the owner of this item you may not view this screen: . This may be because you have deposited the item and you may no longer make changes to it.
This item is temporarily locked to allow your modifications only. The lock may be released via a button in the Actions tab.
This item is temporarily locked to allow modifications by only.
Take the edit lock from the user currently editing this record.
Sorry, but your edit lock on has been overridden by an editor. Try editing this record again later.
You have taken over the edit lock for this item.
Release your lock on this item.
You have released your lock on this item.

epp:phrase.p: This item is currently being modified by another user, and will remain locked for a few minutes after they stop editing, unless they choose to release it sooner.
This item has been locked since .
This item will be locked until at least ( seconds)
Locked by:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Sorry, you are not able to use any tools
To import items from an external source enter the required data below. To test whether the data to import is correctly formatted click , otherwise click to import.

Select an archive from your system: e.g. my_photos.zip
Each file inside this archive will be created as an individual document inside the resulting eprint.
Enter a DOI or DOIs, one per line e.g. doi:10.1006/jmbi.1998.2354

Enter an ISI query string:
AU = (Carr) and TI = (open access)
PY = 2006 and OG = (Cambridge)

tr.td: OR select a file to import from:
Either cut-and-paste BibTeX entries into this box:
OR select a file to import from:

Encountered more than one set of input - make sure you haven't filled in more than one field.
Test run failed: item(s) found before an error caused the test run to abort. Carefully check any warning messages before proceeding.
Import failed: item(s) imported before an error caused the import to abort.

Cut and paste import records
or
Upload import file
Import full texts in addition to metadata if full text is available
Could not deposit due to validation errors.
Could not deposit for some reason.
Your item will not appear on the public website until it has been checked by an editor.
Remove this item from the system forever, but send an email to the user who deposited it to inform them why.
Return this item from to the user work area and send an email to the user who deposited it to explain why it cannot yet be accepted.
Remove this item from the system forever.

The username given was not a valid user account
Transferred ownership of this eprint to "".
Problem changing status of item with the ID "".
Return to user work area, allowing the user to make changes to it and re-deposit it.
Removes the item from the archive.
Item has been queued for re-indexing (may take some time to complete).
Use this to submit a new version of this item. It will create an exact copy which you can then make changes to. This item and the new version will be linked.
New versions successfully created in your work area. You are now viewing the new version.
Create a new item using this item as a template. There will be no connection between the two items.
New item successfully created in your work area using the previous item as a template. You are now viewing the new item.

epp:phrase.p: User (Email: ) requests the removal of the following item:
View the item details.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Request that this item is removed from the repository.

p.em: Please note that we strongly discourage removal of items from the repository. If you upload a new version of an items, a link to the later version will appear on the older version. Thus, anyone finding the old version will be able to see that a newer version has been deposited.

epp:phrase.p: The current issues section may not contain all issues discovered in the periodic audit, such as items with similar titles.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Search for issues discovered in current records.

epp:phrase.p: Search for items by issue. The issues are updated periodically.
You may view your saved searches and request to receive a periodic email update if anything in the search changes.
To create a new saved search, carry out a search and select Save search from the search results page.
You currently have no saved searches.
Are you sure you want to delete this saved search?

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Something went wrong with creating your saved search. Sorry.
That search has expired or was not created by you!
This saved search is not available to the public.

No ID given for new child
A subject with that id already exists.
The specified subject does not exist, or a database error has occurred.
Unlinked subject. This subject node still exists in other places in the subject tree.
Removed subject. This subject node has been deleted.
Created new subject node with ID "". Please now enter a subject name and set the subject to be depositable, if applicable.
Linked the existing subject node "" as a child of this subject node.

Deleting
Unlinking this subject will cause it to be permanently deleted. Are you sure you want to do this?
Search for items in this repository.
Search for users of this repository.
Search for actions that have occurred on items in this repository.

epp:phrase.p: To upload a document to this repository, click the Browse button below to select the file and the Upload button to upload it to the archive. You may then add additional files to the document (such as images for HTML files) or upload more files to create additional documents.
You may wish to use the SHERPA RoMEO tool to verify publisher policies before depositing.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: To convert this document to another format select the format you wish to convert it to and click 'Convert'. The conversion will create a new document - your old document will not be lost.
Drop files here to begin uploading.
The uploaded file type is not supported by this repository.
Upload Failed, could not uncompress uploaded file.
Delete entire document: are you sure?
Remove the relation to parent document: are you sure?

epp:phrase.epc:pin: Click to add supplementary files to this document

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Wait! Are you really sure you want to add another file to this document? Only do this if the file is directly required by the document. For example an image required by an HTML document. If you are sure you want to then click OK. Most of the time you want to click Cancel then use the New Document field above.
Wait! You have selected a file to upload but not actually uploaded it. Do you wish to continue without uploading the file?

File imports are currently disabled, failed to import: . To enable file imports set "enable_file_imports" to 1 in SystemSettings (this is a security risk and should be disabled when your import is done).

Attempt to import eprint with document data expressed as a local filename. This is a security hole in normal use, and is disabled. It *is* useful when bulk importing and may be enabled by setting enable_file_imports.

New or changed items matching this search will be mailed to you.
How often do you want to be sent this alert? A setting of "never" disables this alert.
If there are no new items matching your saved search, since it was last mailed, do you still want to be mailed?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, mail me empty alerts.
No. Only mail me alerts with content.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Do you want to be able to link directly to this search via a public URL?

epp:phrase.label: Yes, make this search available to anyone.
No. Only I will have access to this search.

If you do not receive a reply or need advice at a later time please contact the administrator. For items with copyright implications, you may also be able to contact your local inter-library loan service.

epp:phrase.div: This tool writes modified phrases to zz_webcfg.xml. Click the phrase text to edit it. Javascript required.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This phrase is used in the page, but has not been defined yet.
Full configuration reload required for this phrase to change will appear. You don't have rights to do that.

epp:phrase.p: You have chosen to accept the request for the following item:
An acceptance notice will be emailed to the requester with the requested document attached.
You have chosen to reject the request for the following item:
You may enter a reason below if you wish. This will be emailed to the requester along with a rejection notice.
This item has been made publicly accessible since the request was made:
A notice will be emailed to the requester.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Tick here to make this document publicly available from now on.

Your request for the following item has been rejected:
It may not always be straightforward to provide full text. Your local library may also be able to help you. For more general queries you may also contact the administrator.

This option allows or prevents a users email being shown on their public summary page.

epp:phrase.label: Make email visible to all.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Please list keyword/phrases describing your areas of specialisation using the terms likely to be used by someone searching for work in those areas. Avoid over-general terms (`chemistry') and over-particular terms (`my non-quantal theory of chemical reactions') that no one is likely to search on. Enter as many keyword/phrases as you wish.
